Caption: Figure 1: Trending Pool for Trending Event Composition – Visualization Layout: Widget (b) is for visualizing the trending event compositions using sparse codewords by trending candidate bases, i.e., columns in the heatmap, while the importance of trending candidate-bases is shown in widget (a). Also, we draw the trending and volume bubbles, detailed in (e), to show the volume change for each trending candidate in “trending pool” shown in widget (c). In each bubble, we encode the current time traffic of the candidate as the outer radius, its mean traffic in the scoring window as the inner radius, and the buzz score is embedded in colors. Besides, user can explore the trending events in different timestamps with the time selection widget (d). This visualization shows a trending event formed by song genre 2, which indicates English pop songs. Another event is composed by users born in the year ranging from 1985 to 1989 listening to song genre 23, Korean songs, at 10 a.m. April 7th, 2014.
Figure 2: Global Peak vs. Local Trend: In (1), the ranking of volume counts is always dominated by global peaks thus we can hardly see those small but climbing candidates shown in (2).

Figure 3: System Flow: After (A) detecting candidates by trending detection in the “trending pool”, (B) the logs with trending candidates are filtered and expanded before (C) performing sparse coding as solution for trending event composition discovering. In (C) we factorized the filtered data X to dictionary D with k codewords, i.e., the trending candidate-bases, and the codeword coefficient matrix A. As in figure, initially we detect the trending candidates of column genre and singer then put them in the current trending pool. Next, we conduct categorical data trending to deploy the sparse coding. We can obtain the candidate-bases importance by the expansion on the logs with detected trending candidates candidates row summation in A, and get the most important event genre:formed 1 by codeword d1, a.k.a., genre=1 and singer=B. At last, we project the discovered trending candidate-bases, their importance, and the traffic genre: 2 volume information for each candidate, e.g., genre=1, to visual layout (D).
